Cranston.Darius Goff:
Darius Goff (10 May 1809 – 14 April 1891) was one of the foremost textile manufacturers in the United States and a leading citizen of Pawtucket, Rhode Island. He is known for introducing the manufacture of worsted braids and mohair plush upholstery into the United States.


== Biography ==


=== Early life ===
Goff was born in Rehoboth, Massachusetts into a textile mill–owning family.
